title: Standard Form
text: Standard form has a $$1$$ as the constant in the denominator, so we have to divide the numerator and denominator by that constant (to make it 1).

title: Convert to Standard Form
text: Divide numerator and denominator by the constant in the denominator, $$4$$.

title: Directrix
text: sinθ is in the denominator, so the directrix is $$y=±p$$.

title: Eccentricity
text: Eccentricity is the coefficient in front of the sinθ or cosθ in the denominator, which is $$1$$.

title: Identify
text: If $$0 \leq e<1$$, the conic is an ellipse. If $$e=1$$, the conic is a parabola. If $$e>1$$, the conic is a hyperbola.

title: Directrix
text: The numerator in a conic is the product of the eccentricity and the directrix. So, the directrix is $$y=\frac{\frac{3}{4}}{\left(-1\right)}=\frac{-3}{4}$$.
